00044 ## @brief The RecordGroup class manages a list of records.
00045 # 
00046 # Provides functions for loading, storing and creating new objects of the same type.
00047 # The 'fields' property stores a dictionary of dictionaries, each of which contains 
00048 # information about a field. This information includes the data type ('type'), its name
00049 # ('name') and other attributes. The 'fieldObjects' property stores the classes responsible
00050 # for managing the values which are finally stored on the 'values' dictionary in the
00051 # Model
00052 #
00053 # The group can also be sorted by any of it's fields. Two sorting methods are provided:
00054 # SortVisibleItems and SortAllItems. SortVisibleItems is usually faster for a small
00055 # number of elements as sorting is handled on the client side, but only those loaded
00056 # are considered in the sorting. SortAllItems, sorts items in the server so all items
00057 # are considered. Although this would cost a lot when there are thousands of items, 
00058 # only some of them are loaded and the rest are loaded on demand.
00059 #
00060 # Note that by default the group will handle (and eventually load) all records that match 
00061 # the conditions imposed by 'domain' and 'filter'. Those are empty by default so creating 
00062 # RecordGroup('res.parnter') and iterating through it's items will return all partners
00063 # in the database. If you want to ensure that the group is kept completely empty, you can
00064 # call setAllowRecordLoading( False ) which is equivalent to calling setFilter() with a filter 
00065 # that no records match, but without the overhead of querying the server.
00066 #
00067 # RecordGroup will emit several kinds of signals on certain events. 
00068 class RecordGroup(QObject):
00069 
00070         SortVisibleItems = 1
00071         SortAllItems = 2
00072 
00073         SortingPossible = 0
00074         SortingNotPossible = 1
00075         SortingOnlyGroups = 2
00076         SortingNotPossibleModified = 3
00077 
00078         ## @brief Creates a new RecordGroup object.
00079         # @param resource Name of the model to load. Such as 'res.partner'.
00080         # @param fields Dictionary with the fields to load. This value typically comes from the server.
00081         # @param ids Record identifiers to load in the group.
00082         # @param parent Only used if this RecordGroup serves as a relation to another model. Otherwise it's None.
00083         # @param context Context for RPC calls.
00084         def __init__(self, resource, fields = None, ids=None, parent=None, context=None):
00085                 QObject.__init__(self)
00086                 if ids is None:
00087                         ids = []
00088                 if context is None:
00089                         context = {}
00090                 self.parent = parent
00091                 self._context = context
00092                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00093                 self.resource = resource
00094                 self.limit = Settings.value( 'koo.limit', 80, int )
00095                 self.maximumLimit = self.limit
00096                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(resource)
00097                 if fields == None:
00098                         self.fields = {}
00099                 else:
00100                         self.fields = fields
00101                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00102                 self.loadFieldObjects( self.fields.keys() )
00103 
00104                 self.records = []
00105 
00106                 self.enableSignals()
00107                 
00108                 # toBeSorted properties store information each time sort() function
00109                 # is called. If loading of records is not enabled, records won't be
00110                 # loaded but we keep by which field we want information to be sorted
00111                 # so when record loading is enabled again we know how should the sorting
00112                 # be.
00113                 self.toBeSortedField = None
00114                 self.toBeSortedOrder = None
00115 
00116                 self.sortedField = None
00117                 self.sortedOrder = None
00118                 self.updated = False
00119                 self._domain = []
00120                 self._filter = []
00121 
00122                 if Settings.value('koo.sort_mode') == 'visible_items':
00123                         self._sortMode = self.SortVisibleItems
00124                 else:
00125                         self._sortMode = self.SortAllItems
00126                 self._sortMode = self.SortAllItems
00127 
00128                 self.load(ids)
00129                 self.removedRecords = []
00130                 self._onWriteFunction = ''
00131 
00132         ## @brief Sets wether data loading should be done on record chunks or one by one.
00133         #
00134         # Setting value to True, will make the RecordGroup ignore the current 'limit' property,
00135         # and load records by one by, instead. If set to False (the default) it will load records
00136         # in groups of 'limit' (80, by default).
00137         #
00138         # In some cases (widgets that show multiple records) it's better to load in chunks, in other
00139         # cases, it's better to load one by one.
00140         def setLoadOneByOne(self, value):
00141                 if value:
00142                         self.limit = 1
00143                 else:
00144                         self.limit = self.maximumLimit
00145 
00146         def setSortMode(self, mode):
00147                 self._sortMode = mode
00148 
00149         def sortMode(self):
00150                 return self._sortMode
00151 
00152         def setOnWriteFunction(self, value):
00153                 self._onWriteFunction = value
00154 
00155         def onWriteFunction(self):
00156                 return self._onWriteFunction
00157 
00158         def __del__(self):
00159                 if self.parent:
00160                         self.disconnect(self,SIGNAL('modified'),self.tomanyfield.groupModified)
00161                         self.tomanyfield = None
00162                 self.rpc = None
00163                 self.parent = None
00164                 self.resource = None
00165                 self._context = None
00166                 self.fields = None
00167                 for r in self.records:
00168                         if not isinstance(r, Record):
00169                                 continue
00170                         self.disconnect(r,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00171                         self.disconnect(r,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordModified)
00172                         r.__del__()
00173                 self.records = []
00174                 for f in self.fieldObjects:
00175                         self.fieldObjects[f].parent = None
00176                         self.fieldObjects[f].setParent( None )
00177                         #self.fieldObjects[f].__del__()
00178                         #self.disconnect( self.fieldObjects[f], None, 0, 0 )
00179                         #self.fieldObjects[f] = None
00180                         #del self.fieldObjects[f]
00181                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00182 
00183         ## @brief Returns a string with the name of the type of a given field. Such as 'char'.
00184         def fieldType( self, fieldName ):
00185                 if not fieldName in self.fields:
00186                         return None
00187                 return self.fields[fieldName]['type']
00188 
00189         # Creates the entries in 'fieldObjects' for each key of the 'fkeys' list.
00190         def loadFieldObjects(self, fkeys):
00191                 for fname in fkeys:
00192                         fvalue = self.fields[fname]
00193                         fvalue['name'] = fname
00194                         self.fieldObjects[fname] = Field.FieldFactory.create( fvalue['type'], self, fvalue )
00195                         if fvalue['type'] in ('binary','image'):
00196                                 self.fieldObjects['%s.size' % fname] = Field.FieldFactory.create( 'binary-size', self, fvalue )
00197 
00198         ## @brief Saves all the records. 
00199         #
00200         # Note that there will be one request to the server per modified or 
00201         # created record.
00202         def save(self):
00203                 for record in self.records:
00204                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00205                                 saved = record.save()
00206 
00207         ## @brief Returns a list with all modified records
00208         def modifiedRecords(self):
00209                 modified = []
00210                 for record in self.records:
00211                         if isinstance( record, Record ) and record.isModified():
00212                                 modified.append( record )
00213                 return modified
00214 
00215         ## @brief This function executes the 'onWriteFunction' function in the server.
00216         #
00217         # If there is a 'onWriteFunction' function associated with the model type handled by 
00218         # this record group it will be executed. 'editedId' should provide the 
00219         # id of the just saved record.
00220         #
00221         # This functionality is provided here instead of on the record because
00222         # the remote function might update some other records, and they need to
00223         # be (re)loaded.
00224         def written( self, editedId ):
00225                 if not self._onWriteFunction or not editedId:
00226                         return
00227                 # Execute the onWriteFunction function on the server.
00228                 # It's expected it'll return a list of ids to be loaded or reloaded.
00229                 new_ids = getattr(self.rpc, self._onWriteFunction)( editedId, self.context() )
00230                 record_idx = self.records.index( self.recordById( editedId ) )
00231                 result = False
00232                 indexes = []
00233                 for id in new_ids:
00234                         cont = False
00235                         for m in self.records:
00236                                 if isinstance( m, Record ):
00237                                         if m.id == id:
00238                                                 cont = True
00239                                                 # TODO: Shouldn't we just call cancel() so the record
00240                                                 # is reloaded on demand?
00241                                                 m.reload()
00242                         if cont:
00243                                 continue
00244                         # TODO: Should we reconsider this? Do we need/want to reload. Probably we
00245                         # only want to add the id to the list.
00246                         record = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00247                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00248                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00249                         record.reload()
00250                         if not result:
00251                                 result = record
00252                         newIndex = min(record_idx, len(self.records)-1)
00253                         self.add(record, newIndex)
00254                         indexes.append(newIndex)
00255 
00256                 if indexes:
00257                         self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), min(indexes), max(indexes) )
00258                 return result
00259         
00260         ## @brief Adds a list of records as specified by 'values'.
00261         #
00262         # 'values' has to be a list of dictionaries, each of which containing fields
00263         # names -> values. At least key 'id' needs to be in all dictionaries.
00264         def loadFromValues(self, values):
00265                 start = len(self.records)
00266                 for value in values:
00267                         record = Record(value['id'], self, parent=self.parent)
00268                         record.set(value)
00269                         self.records.append(record)
00270                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00271                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00272                 end = len(self.records)-1
00273                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00274         
00275         ## @brief Creates as many records as len(ids) with the ids[x] as id.
00276         #
00277         # 'ids' needs to be a list of identifiers. The addFields() function
00278         # can be used later to load the necessary fields for each record.
00279         def load(self, ids, addOnTop=False):
00280                 if not ids:
00281                         return 
00282                 if addOnTop:
00283                         start = 0
00284                         # Discard from 'ids' those that are already loaded.
00285                         # If we didn't do that, some records could be repeated if the programmer
00286                         # doesn't verify that, and we'd end up in errors because when records are
00287                         # actually loaded they're only checked against a single appearance of the 
00288                         # id in the list of records.
00289                         #
00290                         # Note we don't use sets to discard ids, because we want to keep the order
00291                         # their order and because it can cause infinite recursion.
00292                         currentIds = self.ids()
00293                         for id in ids:
00294                                 if id not in currentIds:
00295                                         self.records.insert( 0, id )
00296                         end = len(ids)-1
00297                 else:
00298                         start = len(self.records)
00299                         # Discard from 'ids' those that are already loaded. Same as above.
00300                         currentIds = self.ids()
00301                         for id in ids:
00302                                 if id not in currentIds:
00303                                         self.records.append( id )
00304                         end = len(self.records)-1
00305                 # We consider the group is updated because otherwise calling count() would
00306                 # force an update() which would cause one2many relations to load elements
00307                 # when we only want to know how many are there.
00308                 self.updated = True
00309                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00310 
00311         ## @brief Clears the list of records. It doesn't remove them.
00312         def clear(self):
00313                 for record in self.records:
00314                         if isinstance(record, Record):
00315                                 self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00316                                 self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordModified )
00317                 last = len(self.records)-1
00318                 self.records = []
00319                 self.removedRecords = []
00320                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), 0, last )
00321         
00322         ## @brief Returns a copy of the current context
00323         def context(self):
00324                 ctx = {}
00325                 ctx.update(self._context)
00326                 return ctx
00327 
00328         ## @brief Sets the context that will be used for RPC calls.
00329         def setContext(self, context):
00330                 self._context = context.copy()
00331 
00332         ## @brief Adds a record to the list
00333         def add(self, record, position=-1):
00334                 if not record.group is self:
00335                         fields = {}
00336                         for mf in record.group.fields:
00337                                 fields[record.group.fields[mf]['name']] = record.group.fields[mf]
00338                         self.addFields(fields)
00339                         record.group.addFields(self.fields)
00340                         record.group = self
00341 
00342                 if position==-1:
00343                         self.records.append(record)
00344                 else:
00345                         self.records.insert(position, record)
00346                 record.parent = self.parent
00347                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordChanged)
00348                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00349                 return record
00350 
00351         ## @brief Creates a new record of the same type of the records in the group.
00352         #
00353         # If 'default' is true, the record is filled in with default values. 
00354         # 'domain' and 'context' are only used if default is true.
00355         def create(self, default=True, position=-1, domain=None, context=None):
00356                 if domain is None:
00357                         domain = []
00358                 if context is None:
00359                         context = {}
00360                 self.ensureUpdated()
00361 
00362                 record = Record(None, self, parent=self.parent, new=True)
00363                 if default:
00364                         ctx=context.copy()
00365                         ctx.update( self.context() )
00366                         record.fillWithDefaults(domain, ctx)
00367                 self.add( record, position )
00368                 if position == -1:
00369                         start = len(self.records) - 1
00370                 else:
00371                         start = position
00372                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, start )
00373                 return record
00374 
00375         def disableSignals(self):
00376                 self._signalsEnabled = False
00377 
00378         def enableSignals(self):
00379                 self._signalsEnabled = True
00380         
00381         def recordChanged(self, record):
00382                 if self._signalsEnabled:
00383                         self.emit( SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'), record )
00384 
00385         def recordModified(self, record):
00386                 if self._signalsEnabled:
00387                         self.emit( SIGNAL('modified') )
00388 
00389         ## @brief Removes a record from the record group but not from the server.
00390         #
00391         # If the record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00392         def removeRecord(self, record):
00393                 idx = self.records.index(record)
00394                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00395                         id = record.id
00396                 else:
00397                         id = record
00398                 if id:
00399                         # Only store removedRecords if they have a valid Id.
00400                         # Otherwise we don't need them because they don't have 
00401                         # to be removed in the server.
00402                         self.removedRecords.append( id )
00403                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00404                         if record.parent:
00405                                 record.parent.modified = True
00406                 self.freeRecord( record )
00407                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified') )
00408                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), idx, idx )
00409 
00410         ## @brief Remove a list of records from the record group but not from the server.
00411         #
00412         # If a record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00413         def removeRecords(self, records):
00414                 firstIdx = -1
00415                 lastIdx = -1
00416                 toRemove = []
00417                 for record in records:
00418                         if not record in records:
00419                                 continue
00420                         idx = self.records.index(record)
00421                         if firstIdx < 0 or idx < firstIdx:
00422                                 firstIdx = idx
00423                         if lastIdx < 0 or idx > lastIdx:
00424                                 lastIdx = idx
00425                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00426                                 id = record.id
00427                         else:
00428                                 id = record
00429                         if id:
00430                                 # Only store removedRecords if they have a valid Id.
00431                                 # Otherwise we don't need them because they don't have 
00432                                 # to be removed in the server.
00433                                 self.removedRecords.append( id )
00434                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00435                                 if record.parent:
00436                                         record.parent.modified = True
00437                         self.freeRecord( record )
00438                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified') )
00439                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), firstIdx, lastIdx )
00440 
00441         ## @brief Removes a record from the record group but not from the server.
00442         #
00443         # If the record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00444         def remove(self, record):
00445                 if isinstance(record, list):
00446                         self.removeRecords( record )
00447                 else:
00448                         self.removeRecord( record )     
00449 
00450         def binaryFieldNames(self):
00451                 return [x[:-5] for x in self.fieldObjects.keys() if x.endswith('.size')]
00452 
00453         def allFieldNames(self):
00454                 return [x for x in self.fieldObjects.keys() if not x.endswith('.size')]
00455 
00456         ## @brief Adds the specified fields to the record group
00457         #
00458         # Note that it updates 'fields' and 'fieldObjects' in the group.
00459         # 'fields' is a dict of dicts as typically returned by 
00460         # the server.
00461         def addFields(self, fields):
00462                 to_add = []
00463                 for f in fields.keys():
00464                         if not f in self.fields:
00465                                 self.fields[f] = fields[f]
00466                                 self.fields[f]['name'] = f
00467                                 to_add.append(f)
00468                         else:
00469                                 self.fields[f].update(fields[f])
00470                 self.loadFieldObjects(to_add)
00471                 return to_add
00472 
00473 
00474         ## @brief Ensures all records in the group are loaded.
00475         def ensureAllLoaded(self):
00476                 ids = self.unloadedIds()
00477                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00478                 c.update( self.context() )
00479                 c['bin_size'] = True
00480                 values = self.rpc.read( ids, self.fields.keys(), c )
00481                 if values:
00482                         for v in values:
00483                                 #self.recordById( v['id'] ).set(v, signal=False)
00484                                 r = self.recordById( v['id'] )
00485                                 r.set(v, signal=False)
00486 
00487         ## @brief Returns the list of ids that have not been loaded yet. The list
00488         # won't include new records as those have id 0 or None.
00489         def unloadedIds(self):
00490                 self.ensureUpdated()
00491                 ids = []
00492                 for x in self.records:
00493                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00494                                 if x.id and not x._loaded:
00495                                         ids.append( x.id )
00496                         elif x:
00497                                 ids.append( x )
00498                 return ids
00499 
00500         ## @brief Returns the list of loaded records. The list won't include new records.
00501         def loadedRecords(self):
00502                 records = []
00503                 for x in self.records:
00504                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00505                                 if x.id and x._loaded:
00506                                         records.append( x )
00507                 return records
00508 
00509         ## @brief Returns a list with all ids.
00510         def ids(self):
00511                 ids = []
00512                 for x in self.records:
00513                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00514                                 ids.append( x.id )
00515                         else:
00516                                 ids.append( x )
00517                 return ids
00518 
00519         ## @brief Returns a list with all new records.
00520         def newRecords(self):
00521                 records = []
00522                 for x in self.records:
00523                         if not isinstance(x, Record):
00524                                 continue
00525                         if x.id:
00526                                 continue
00527                         records.append( x )
00528                 return records
00529 
00530         ## @brief Returns the number of records in this group.
00531         def count(self):
00532                 self.ensureUpdated()
00533                 return len(self.records)
00534 
00535         def __iter__(self):
00536                 self.ensureUpdated()
00537                 self.ensureAllLoaded()
00538                 return iter(self.records)
00539 
00540         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00541         # Note that it will check if the record is loaded and load it if not.
00542         def modelById(self, id):
00543                 record = self.recordById( id )
00544                 if not record:
00545                         return None
00546                 return record
00547         __getitem__ = modelById
00548 
00549         ## @brief Returns the record at the specified row number.
00550         def modelByIndex(self, row):
00551                 record = self.recordByIndex( row )
00552                 return record
00553 
00554         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given record. Note that
00555         # the record must be in the group. Otherwise an exception is risen.
00556         def indexOfRecord(self, record):
00557                 if record in self.records:
00558                         return self.records.index(record)
00559                 else:
00560                         return -1
00561                 
00562         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given id.
00563         # If the id doesn't exist it returns -1.
00564         def indexOfId(self, id):
00565                 i = 0
00566                 for record in self.records:
00567                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00568                                 if record.id == id:
00569                                         return i
00570                         elif record == id:
00571                                 return i
00572                         i += 1
00573                 return -1
00574 
00575         ## @brief Returns True if the given record exists in the group.
00576         def recordExists(self, record):
00577                 return record in self.records
00578 
00579         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00580         # Note that it will return the record but won't try to load it.
00581         def recordById(self, id):
00582                 for record in self.records:
00583                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00584                                 if record.id == id:
00585                                         return record
00586                         elif record == id:
00587                                 idx = self.records.index( id )
00588                                 record = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00589                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00590                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00591                                 self.records[idx] = record 
00592                                 return record
00593 
00594         ## @brief Returns a Record object for the given row.
00595         def recordByIndex(self, row):
00596                 record = self.records[row]
00597                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00598                         return record
00599                 else:
00600                         record = Record(record, self, parent=self.parent)
00601                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00602                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00603                         self.records[row] = record
00604                         return record
00605         
00606         ## @brief Returns True if the RecordGroup handles information of a wizard.
00607         def isWizard(self):
00608                 return self.resource.startswith('wizard.')
00609 
00610         ## @brief Checks whether the specified record is fully loaded and loads
00611         # it if necessary.
00612         def ensureModelLoaded(self, record):
00613                 self.ensureUpdated()
00614                 # Do not try to load if record is new.
00615                 if not record.id:
00616                         record.createMissingFields()
00617                         return
00618                 if record.isFullyLoaded():
00619                         return
00620 
00621                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00622                 c.update( self.context() )
00623                 ids = self.ids()
00624                 pos = ids.index(record.id) / self.limit
00625 
00626                 queryIds = ids[pos * self.limit: pos * self.limit + self.limit]
00627                 if None in queryIds:
00628                         queryIds.remove( None )
00629 
00630                 missingFields = record.missingFields()
00631 
00632                 self.disableSignals()
00633                 c['bin_size'] = True
00634                 values = self.rpc.read(queryIds, missingFields, c)
00635                 if values:
00636                         for v in values:
00637                                 id = v['id']
00638                                 if 'id' not in missingFields:
00639                                         del v['id']
00640                                 self.recordById(id).set(v, signal=False)
00641                 self.enableSignals()
00642                 # TODO: Take a look if we need to set default values for new records!
00643                 ## Set defaults
00644                 #if len(new) and len(to_add):
00645                         #values = self.rpc.default_get( to_add, self.context() )
00646                         #for t in to_add:
00647                                 #if t not in values:
00648                                         #values[t] = False
00649                         #for mod in new:
00650                                 #mod.setDefaults(values)
00651 
00652         ## @brief Allows setting the domain for this group of records.
00653         def setDomain(self, value):
00654                 # In some (rare) cases we receive {} as domain. So let's just test
00655                 # 'not value', and that should work in all cases, not only when value
00656                 # is None.
00657                 if not value:
00658                         self._domain = []
00659                 else:
00660                         self._domain = value
00661                 if Settings.value( 'koo.load_on_open', True ):
00662                         self.updated = False
00663         
00664         ## @brief Returns the current domain.
00665         def domain(self):
00666                 return self._domain
00667 
00668         ## @brief Allows setting a filter for this group of records.
00669         #
00670         # The filter is conatenated to the domain to further restrict the records of
00671         # the group.
00672         def setFilter(self, value):
00673                 if value == None:
00674                         self._filter = []
00675                 else:
00676                         self._filter = value
00677                 self.updated = False
00678         
00679         ## @brief Returns the current filter.
00680         def filter(self):
00681                 return self._filter
00682 
00683         ## @brief Disables record loading by setting domain to [('id','in',[])]
00684         #
00685         # RecordGroup will optimize the case when domain + filter = [('id','in',[])]
00686         # by not even querying the server and searching ids. It will simply consider
00687         # the result is [] and thus the group will be kept empty.
00688         #
00689         # Domain may be changed using setDomain() function.
00690         def setDomainForEmptyGroup(self):
00691                 self.setDomain([('id','in',[])])
00692                 self.clear()
00693 
00694         ## @brief Returns True if domain is [('id','in',[])]
00695         def isDomainForEmptyGroup(self):
00696                 return self.domain() == [('id','in',[])]
00697 
00698         ## @brief Reload the record group with current selected sort field, order, domain and filter
00699         def update(self):
00700                 # Update context from Rpc.session.context as language
00701                 # (or other settings) might have changed.
00702                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00703                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00704                 ## Make it reload again
00705                 self.updated = False
00706                 self.sort( self.toBeSortedField, self.toBeSortedOrder )
00707 
00708         ## @brief Ensures the group is updated.
00709         def ensureUpdated(self):
00710                 if self.updated:
00711                         return
00712                 self.update()
00713 
00714         ## @brief Sorts the group by the given field name.
00715         def sort(self, field, order):
00716                 self.toBeSortedField = field
00717                 self.toBeSortedOrder = order
00718                 if self._sortMode == self.SortAllItems:
00719                         self.sortAll( field, order )
00720                 else:
00721                         self.sortVisible( field, order )
00722 
00723         # Sorts the records in the group using ALL records in the database
00724         def sortAll(self, field, order):
00725                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00726                         return
00727 
00728                 # Check there're no new or modified fields. If there are
00729                 # we won't sort as it means reloading data from the server
00730                 # and we'd loose current changes.
00731                 if self.isModified():
00732                         self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), self.SortingNotPossibleModified )
00733                         return
00734 
00735                 oldSortedField = self.sortedField
00736 
00737                 # We set this fields in the very beggining in case some signals are cought
00738                 # and retry to sort again which would cause an infinite recursion.
00739                 self.sortedField = field
00740                 self.sortedOrder = order
00741                 self.updated = True
00742 
00743                 sorted = False
00744                 sortingResult = self.SortingPossible
00745 
00746                 if self._domain + self._filter == [('id','in',[])]:
00747                         # If setDomainForEmptyGroup() was called, or simply the domain
00748                         # included no tuples, we don't even need to query the server.
00749                         # Note that this may be quite important in some wizards because
00750                         # the model will actually not exist in the server and would raise
00751                         # an exception.
00752                         ids = []
00753                 elif not field in self.fields.keys():
00754                         # If the field doesn't exist use default sorting. Usually this will
00755                         # happen when we update and haven't selected a field to sort by.
00756                         ids = self.rpc.search( self._domain + self._filter, 0, False, False, self._context )
00757                 else:
00758                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00759                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00760                                 # We're not able to sort 2many fields
00761                                 sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00762                         elif type == 'many2one':
00763                                 # This works only if '#407667' is fixed, but it was fixed in 2010-02-03
00764                                 orderby = '"%s"' % field
00765                                 if order == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00766                                         orderby += " ASC"
00767                                 else:
00768                                         orderby += " DESC"
00769                                 try:
00770                                         ids = Rpc.session.call('/koo', 'search', self.resource, self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, orderby, self._context )
00771                                         sortingResult = self.SortingPossible
00772                                         sorted = True
00773                                 except:
00774                                         sortingResult = self.SortingOnlyGroups
00775 
00776                         # We check whether the field is stored or not. In case the server 
00777                         # is not _ready_ we consider it's stored and we'll catch the exception
00778                         # later.
00779                         stored = self.fields[field].get('stored',True)
00780                         if not stored:
00781                                 sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00782 
00783                         if not sorted and sortingResult != self.SortingNotPossible:
00784                                 # A lot of the work done here should be done on the server by core OpenERP
00785                                 # functions. This means this runs slower than it should due to network and
00786                                 # serialization latency. Even more, we lack some information to make it 
00787                                 # work well.
00788 
00789                                 # Ensure the field is quoted, otherwise fields such as 'to' can't be sorted
00790                                 # and return an exception.
00791                                 orderby = '"%s"' % field 
00792                                 if order == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00793                                         orderby += " ASC"
00794                                 else:
00795                                         orderby += " DESC"
00796 
00797                                 try:
00798                                         # Use call to catch exceptions
00799                                         ids = Rpc.session.call('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'search', self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, orderby, self._context )
00800                                 except:
00801                                         # In functional fields not stored in the database this will
00802                                         # cause an exception :(
00803                                         sortingResult = self.SortingNotPossible
00804 
00805                 if sortingResult != self.SortingNotPossible:
00806                         self.clear()
00807                         # The load function will be in charge of loading and sorting elements
00808                         self.load( ids )
00809                 elif oldSortedField == self.sortedField or not self.ids():
00810                         # If last sorted field was the same as the current one, possibly only filter crierias have changed
00811                         # so we might need to reload in this case. 
00812                         # If sorting is not possible, but no data was loaded yet, we load by model default field and order.
00813                         # Otherwise, a view might not load any data.
00814                         ids = self.rpc.search(self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, False, self._context )
00815                         self.clear()
00816                         # The load function will be in charge of loading and sorting elements
00817                         self.load( ids )
00818 
00819                 self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), sortingResult )
00820 
00821         # Sorts the records of the group taking into account only loaded fields.
00822         def sortVisible(self, field, order):
00823                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00824                         return
00825 
00826                 if not self.updated:
00827                         ids = self.rpc.search( self._domain + self._filter, 0, self.limit, False, self._context )
00828                         self.clear()
00829                         self.load( ids )
00830                 
00831                 if not field in self.fields:
00832                         return
00833 
00834                 self.ensureAllLoaded()
00835 
00836                 if field != self.sortedField:
00837                         # Sort only if last sorted field was different than current
00838 
00839                         # We need this function here as we use the 'field' variable
00840                         def ignoreCase(record):
00841                                 v = record.value(field)
00842                                 if isinstance(v, unicode) or isinstance(v, str):
00843                                         return v.lower()
00844                                 else:
00845                                         return v
00846 
00847                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00848                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00849                                 self.records.sort( key=lambda x: len(x.value(field).group) )
00850                         else:
00851                                 self.records.sort( key=ignoreCase )
00852                         if order == Qt.DescendingOrder:
00853                                 self.records.reverse()
00854                 else:
00855                         # If we're only reversing the order, then reverse simply reverse
00856                         if order != self.sortedOrder:
00857                                 self.records.reverse()
00858 
00859                 self.sortedField = field
00860                 self.sortedOrder = order
00861                 self.updated = True
00862 
00863                 # Emit recordsInserted() to ensure KooModel is updated.
00864                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), 0, len(self.records)-1 )
00865 
00866                 self.emit( SIGNAL("sorting"), self.SortingPossible )
00867                 
00868         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00869         def cancel(self):
00870                 for record in self.records[:]:
00871                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00872                                 if not record.id:
00873                                         self.freeRecord( record )
00874                                 elif record.isModified():
00875                                         record.cancel()
00876                         else:
00877                                 if not record:
00878                                         self.freeRecord( record )
00879 
00880         ## @brief Removes a record from the list (but not the record from the database).
00881         #
00882         # This function is used to take care signals are disconnected.
00883         def freeRecord(self, record):
00884                 self.records.remove( record )
00885                 if isinstance(record, Record):
00886                         self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00887                         self.disconnect( record, SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordModified )
00888 
00889         ## @brief Returns True if any of the records in the group has been modified.
00890         def isModified(self):
00891                 for record in self.records:
00892                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00893                                 if record.isModified():
00894                                         return True
00895                 return False
00896 
00897         ## @brief Returns True if the given record has been modified.
00898         def isRecordModified(self, id):
00899                 for record in self.records:
00900                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00901                                 if record.id == id:
00902                                         return record.isModified()
00903                         elif record == id:
00904                                 return False
00905                 return False    
00906 
00907         ## @brief Returns True if the given field is required in the RecordGroup, otherwise returns False.
00908         # Note that this is a flag for the whole group, but each record could have different values depending
00909         # on its state.
00910         def isFieldRequired(self, fieldName):
00911                 required = self.fields[ fieldName ].get('required', False)
00912                 if isinstance(required, bool):
00913                         return required
00914                 if isinstance(required, str) or isinstance(required, unicode):
00915                         if required.lower() == 'true':
00916                                 return True
00917                         if required.lower() == 'false':
00918                                 return False
00919                 return bool(int(required))
00920
